intro: Clidemia rufescens, commonly known as the red-leaf wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Clidemia rufescens is often found in lowland areas and can be an indicator species for certain types of forest ecosystems.
